description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is meeting with President-elect Donald Trump on Friday, according to people familiar with their plans, as the incoming US leader threatens to implement fresh tariffs on neighboring countries unless they halt the flow of illegal drugs and undocumented migrants across borders.
title: Canada’s Trudeau Arrives in Florida for Meeting With Trump

description: Irish Prime Minister Simon Harris’s party is locked in a virtual dead heat with Sinn Fein in the general election, according to the official exit poll, suggesting his decision to go to the country early didn’t go as planned.
title: Irish PM Harris Almost Level With Sinn Fein in Exit Poll

description: President Xi Jinping has built a sprawling security system to prevent violent forces from destabilizing society. A new wave of deadly attacks is putting pressure on officials to expand that surveillance state.
title: China’s Lone-Wolf Attacks Pose Challenge for Xi’s Security State

description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy suggested he’d accept a cease-fire with Russia that left parts of his country occupied in return for NATO security guarantees over the rest, the strongest signal yet that the Ukrainian leader is open to ending the war without regaining all territory.
title: Zelenskiy Open to Cease-Fire If NATO Protects Unoccupied Areas

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva nominated three new central bank board members on Friday as investors pressure for more aggressive interest rate hikes to cool the economy and tame inflation.
title: Lula Names Three Central Bank Directors as Key Rate Rises

description: Mexico is planning to carry out a “cleaning” operation across the country to combat the flow of illegal merchandise entering the country mainly from China, according to the Economy Ministry.
title: Mexico Kicks Off Operation to End Flow of Illegal Chinese Items

description: House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries said lawmakers from his party had been targeted by “violent threats” over the Thanksgiving holiday that included claims of bombs and swatting calls to law enforcement, following similar incidents directed against some of President-elect Donald Trump’s cabinet picks.
title: Democratic Lawmakers Were Targeted by Bomb Threats on Thanksgiving

description: Solar imports from Southeast Asia are being unfairly sold in the US below their production costs, according to initial findings of a Commerce Department review that laid out duties of as much as 271% to counteract the practice.
title: US Hits South Asian Solar Imports With Duties up to 271%

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s team has asked a key conservative activist to present a plan to slash federal funding for universities that refuse to scrap diversity and equity programs.
title: Trump Team Has Ivy League in Sight as It Gears Up Attacks on DEI

description: Mauritius’s new prime minister ordered an independent review of a deal with Britain involving a strategically important US-UK military base in the Indian Ocean, placing the agreement under fresh scrutiny.
title: Mauritius Reviews British Deal Over Joint US-UK Military Base

description: Lithuania expelled three Chinese embassy employees, potentially escalating tensions even as the Baltic nation’s incoming prime minister expressed openness to restoring diplomatic relations with Beijing.
title: Lithuania Expels Three Chinese Staff as Diplomatic Ties Weighed

description: Dutch officials called out the Israeli government for publishing a report about a recent attack on Israel football fans in Amsterdam through social media, a move it called “undesirable.”
title: Dutch Lament That Israel Shared Riot Report on Social Media

description: Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum is convinced that her country can reach a deal with the US to avoid the 25% tariff threatened by US President-elect Donald Trump, she told reporters in Mexico City.
title: Mexico’s President Says She’s Sure Country Can Avoid US Tariffs

description: Prince Mohammed offered to boost trade with the Islamic Republic just as he seeks to nail down a strategic agreement with Washington.
title: Saudi Arabia Strengthens Ties With Both US and Iran Before Trump

description: Think tanks and advocacy groups preparing for a second Trump term have reaped hundreds of millions of dollars in donations since 2020
title: Trump Is Tapping Deep Conservative Network to Press His Agenda

description: The UK House of Commons voted in favor of a landmark bill to legalize assisted dying, potentially putting England and Wales on track to a fundamental social reform that’s largely supported by the British public.
title: UK Lawmakers Vote to Give Assisted Dying Bill Further Debate

description: President Javier Milei is imposing a December deadline on Argentina’s first bid to sell a long list of state-run companies to the private sector, outlining how challenging it will be for the government to unload businesses.
title: Milei’s First Argentina Privatization Beset by $536 Million Debt

description: Russia’s rock-bottom unemployment rate should be the envy of any country, but it’s instead underscoring how the labor shortage fueled by the Kremlin’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine is making it more difficult for companies to operate.
title: Russia’s Tight Labor Market Has Firms Turning to Teens, Retirees to Fill Openings

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: Romanians Pine for a New Vlad the Impaler

description: Early results from Namibia’s presidential and parliamentary elections show the ruling party garnered the most support, albeit markedly less than it did five years ago, unofficial tallies show.
title: Namibia’s Ruling Party Takes Early Election Lead, Unofficial Tallies Show

description: The US and Europe face a breakdown in transatlantic security if they stop supporting Ukraine’s war against Russia, the head of Britain’s foreign intelligence agency warned in his first public remarks since Donald Trump’s election win.
title: MI6 Chief Warns US and Europe Against Cutting Support for Ukraine

description: Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is preparing to cut budgets for some local projects for a second year even as it increases overall spending, reflecting the kingdom’s shifting priorities in a trillion-dollar plan to overhaul the economy.
title: Saudi Wealth Fund’s Shifting Focus Hits Budgets on Some Projects

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government said the US investigation into Gautam Adani involved private individuals, seeking to distance itself from the controversy.
title: Modi’s Government Seeks to Distance Itself From Adani Probe

description: China wields new powers as it confronts the prospect of another trade conflict with the US, expanding its retaliatory reach in recent years to include tools capable of wreaking havoc on global commerce and finance.
title: How China Can Hit Back at Trump: Target US Firms, Turn to India, Africa

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Irish Vote With Tax Bonanza Imperiled by Trump

description: World Trade Organization members agreed to reappoint Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala as director-general for a second term, cementing her in the job for another four years expected to be fraught with tariff disputes.
title: WTO Members Approve Okonjo-Iweala for a Second Term at Helm

description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto announced a 6.5% increase in workers’ minimum wage next year as consumption falters in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.
title: Indonesia to Raise Minimum Wages By 6.5% in 2025, Prabowo Says

description: India’s gross domestic product grew at its slowest pace in almost two years, dampening the outlook in the world’s fastest-expanding major economy and adding to Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s struggles to create jobs for the nation’s young population.
title: India’s Economic Growth Weakens to Almost Two-Year Low

description: Romanian authorities began recounting ballots after an election that shook the country’s political establishment with a victory for a little-known ultranationalist candidate as the country’s top court weighed accusations of outside meddling.
title: Romania Recounts Ballots as Top Court Weighs Outside Meddling

description: BEIRUT (AP) — Insurgents breached Syria’s largest city Friday and clashed with government forces for the first time since 2016, according to a war monitor and fighters, in a surprise attack that sent residents fleeing and added fresh uncertainty to a region reeling from multiple wars.
title: Rebels Breach Syria’s Aleppo in Biggest Advance Since 2016

description: Chad canceled an agreement that allows French troops to operate in the central African nation, one of the few remaining countries that western military forces have used to fight Islamist insurgents in the Sahel region.
title: Chad Cuts French Defense Pact, Curbing Western Security Presence

description: First Ireland, then Portugal and Spain, and now Greece. One after another, countries at the heart of Europe’s debt crisis more than a decade ago are outshining France, as its standing as a safe-and-stable bond market disintegrates.
title: French Yields Close In on Italy With Safe Market Image in Ruins

description: Israel and Lebanon traded accusations of violating a cease-fire deal that’s brought more than a year of fighting to a halt, though the truce appeared to be holding.
title: Israel, Lebanon Trade Claims of Cease-Fire Breach as Truce Holds

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un’s bet on Russia for economic support may end up backfiring if Donald Trump manages to end Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine, according to a study released by a South Korean government-affiliated think tank.
title: Trump May Thwart Kim-Putin Ambition on Economic Ties, Study Says

description: Japan could have faced deflation for several years starting around 2016 without the Bank of Japan’s massive monetary stimulus program, according to research published by the central bank.
title: Japan Stimulus Staved Off Years of Deflation, BOJ Study Says

description: A minister in UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s Cabinet has resigned after it emerged that she received a criminal conviction for incorrectly telling police that a work phone was stolen during a mugging in 2013.
title: UK Transport Secretary Louise Haigh Resigns Over Fraud Conviction

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen, who holds outsize leverage in France’s split parliament, gave Prime Minister Michel Barnier until Monday to accede to her budget demands before she decides whether to topple the government.
title: France’s Le Pen Boosts Budget Demands Ahead of Monday Deadline

description: South Africa has long struggled with its reputation as a volatile and risky emerging market, but is now becoming a favorite among investors seeking to navigate a world with Donald Trump as the US president.
title: Investors Looking for Stability Tap South Africa in Trump Era

description: Protesters clashed with police in the capital of Georgia after the ruling party announced it was delaying talks with the European Union on the country’s potential membership in the bloc.
title: Georgian Protesters Clash With Police After EU Talks Were Frozen

description: South Africa’s business capital is considering tighter water curbs as it battles to maintain aging infrastructure and cope with increased demand.
title: Johannesburg Weighs Tighter Water Restrictions as Supply Falters

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban nominated his longtime finance minister Mihaly Varga to helm the central bank, with investors on alert for potential implications for one of the tightest monetary policies in Europe.
title: Orban Taps Loyal Finance Chief to Helm Hungary Central Bank

description: Louise Haigh has resigned as Transport Secretary after admitting she incorrectly told police that a work mobile phone was stolen in 2013.
title: Louise Haigh Resigns as UK Transport Secretary

description: Russian Defense Minister Andrey Belousov arrived in Pyongyang for talks with North Korean officials, stoking concerns over a further deepening of military cooperation between the two countries.
title: Russia Defense Minister Visits N. Korea as Planes Fly Near South

description: Iceland’s general election this weekend is likely to pave the way for a ramp up of energy production as lack of electricity hampers efforts to diversify the north Atlantic economy.
title: Icelandic Election Set to Usher In a Green Energy Boom

description: But Israel is unlikely to seize the opportunity.
title: Netanyahu Can Leverage the Lebanon Cease-Fire for a Broader Deal

description: Ireland goes to the polls today in a vote that looks closer than previously expected after prime minister Simon Harris lost the momentum that motivated him to call the the snap general election just three weeks ago.
title: Ireland’s Election Looks a Tight Race as Harris Honeymoon Ends

description: A court in Vietnam sentenced the former director and chairwoman of Xuyen Viet Oil, Mai Thi Hong Hanh, to 30 years in jail for masterminding a scheme that caused state asset losses of at least 1.46 trillion dong ($57.6 million), and then bribing officials to cover it up.
title: Vietnam Jails Ex-Xuyen Viet Oil Chief, Others in Graft Crackdown

description: Human error led to the sinking of a New Zealand Navy vessel earlier this year, a Court of Inquiry has found.
title: New Zealand Navy Says Human Error Caused Ship to Sink Off Samoa

description: European lawmakers have called for fresh sanctions on Hong Kong and Chinese officials over the prosecution of former media mogul Jimmy Lai, as the trial of the city’s top security law target enters its final stage.
title: European Lawmakers Call to Sanction Hong Kong Over Jimmy Lai

description: Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is set to lay out his latest policy vision Friday in a speech to an extraordinary session of parliament as he pursues approval of a ¥13.9 trillion ($92 billion) extra budget to fund a stimulus package.
title: Japan’s Ishiba Faces First Major Policy Test With Stimulus Plan

description: Mexico’s Senate on Thursday approved contentious legislation that would eliminate autonomous government watchdogs, including two regulating antitrust issues and the nation’s energy industry, with their functions absorbed by existing ministries in the federal government.
title: Mexico’s Senate Approves Bill to Dismantle Regulatory Watchdogs

description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte will not appear at a probe to explain her apparent threat to have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. assassinated if she is killed, GMA News reported on Friday, citing her lawyer.
title: Philippines VP Duterte Won’t Show Up at Threat Probe, GMA Says

description: Bloomberg.com.
title: Bloomberg Politics

description: Japan’s biggest banks plan to maintain ties to billionaire Gautam Adani despite US bribery charges, even as other global firms including Barclays Plc are reassessing their exposure to the Indian conglomerate.
title: Japanese Banks Sticking With Adani as Jefferies, Barclays Review Ties

description: UK Members of Parliament will hold a landmark vote on assisted dying on Friday as they decide whether to allow terminally ill people with less than six months to live to opt to end their own lives.
title: UK Parliament to Hold First Vote on Assisted Dying in Nine Years
